p: In December 2013, the first autochthonous cases of chikungunya fever in the Americas were recorded in the French-Dutch Caribbean Saint-Martin Island [ 2]. Subsequently, the virus spread to other islands of the French West Indies (Saint-Barthelemy, Martinique and Guadeloupe), to the majority of Caribbean islands and to continental America. By now, this episode has probably involved more than one million people [ 3].
